conclusion: Analyze geometric relationships in the diagram to calculate the length of the transparent part of the light entering the lens.
Figure A shows car headlights 92.8 cm above the ground; Figure B shows a headlight structure with a paraboloid, hemispherical lens, and light-blocking plate.
Light source is at the focal point F of the paraboloid, and light is reflected to the hemispherical lens.
Light enters the hemispherical lens perpendicular to the diameter MN.
Refractive index of the light in the hemispherical lens is n = 4/3.
Transparent part of the light on the lens is a circular segment with radius R.
Length of the transparent part is given by the arc length of the circular segment.
Arc length l of a circular segment with radius R and angle θ is l = (θ/360°) × 2πR.
Angle θ is calculated using the tangent function: tan θ = R/92.8.
Solving for θ, we find θ = arctan(R/92.8).
Substitute θ into the arc length formula: l = (arctan(R/92.8)/360°) × 2πR.
Simplify to find the length of the transparent part.
